content.text: English Title: Object-oriented Programming Code: CNTT1131E
Level Of Education: Undergraduate
Type Of Education: Full-Time
Credits: 3
Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
Lecture: 20 hrs
Presentation and Discussion: 5 hrs
Exercise and discussion: 23 hrs
Self-study: 99 hrs.
Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1128; CNTT1116

Faculty conducting the course: School of Information Technology and Digital Economics, Suite 1310, Building A1, National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong str., Hai Ba Trung dist., Ha Noi, Vietnam.
Kind of the course:

This course provides knowledge about: Basic concepts of object-oriented programming such as classes, objects, constructors, destructors, friend functions.... The characteristics of object-oriented programming methods such as encapsulation, inheritance, and abstraction. Methods of analysis and design of problems in an object-oriented approach; I/O stream operations and file operations. How to catch and handle exceptions. The content of the object-oriented programming method is described through the C++ programming language (Can also use the C# or Java programming language to illustrate)

The course also aims to practice thinking skills, the ability to self-learn the knowledge of object-oriented programming methods by working independently as well as in groups. Learners have the skills to build a real application using object-oriented programming methods.
[1] Nguyen Thanh Thuy, Object-oriented Programming, Publishing scientific and technical, 1999.
[2]. Pham Van At, C++ and Object-oriented Programming, Publishing scientific and technical, 2000.
[3] Pham Van At, Advanced Programming Technical, Publishing scientific and technical, 2000.
[4] Jim Keogh & Mario Giannini, Object-oriented Programming, 2004.
